task.title: Mask Credit Card Numbers
task.shortdesc: Now let's prevent sensitive information from reaching internal databases by using a Field Masker to mask the credit card numbers.

context.p: The Field Masker provides fixed and variable-length masks to mask all data in a field. To reveal specified positions in the data, you can use custom mask. To reveal a group of positions within the data, you can use a regular expression mask to define the structure of the data and then reveal one or more groups.
For the credit card numbers, we'll use the following regular expression to mask all but the last four digits:(.*)([0-9]{4})
The regular expression defines two groups so we can reveal the second group.

step.cmd: Add a Field Masker processor to the canvas and connect the Jython Evaluator to it.
In the Properties panel, click the Mask tab.
Click in the Fields to Mask field. Scroll through the list of fields and select the field that represents credit card data: /credit_card.
step.info: A list of fields displays when the pipeline is valid for data preview. If the list does not display, you can enter the field path manually.
